word_mean: 汗：由汗腺分泌的液体，具咸味，pH值变动于4.5～7.5之间。由外分泌汗腺排出的汗液澄清，具特有的微臭，含有水、氯化钠、痕迹量白蛋白、尿素及其他化合物
其组成成分随多种因素而改变，例如，液体的摄取，外界温度与湿度以及某些激素的活性。由较大、较深的腋窝顶浆分泌汗腺所产生的汗，除上述成分外，尚含有有机物质，这些物质经细菌分解产生恶臭

sentence.Network_en: Do you sweat a lot or flush a lot?
sentence.Network_cn: 你常出汗或是脸上常发烫吗？

sentence.Network_en: She looked up at me with pinpricks of sweat along her hairline.
sentence.Network_cn: 她抬头看了我一眼，发际渗出细密的汗珠。

sentence.Network_en: He awoke from his sleep in a cold sweat.
sentence.Network_cn: 他从睡梦中醒来，浑身冒着冷汗。

phrase.cizu_name: by the sweat of one's brow

jx.jx_en_mean: by one's own hard work, typically manual labour
jx.jx_cn_mean: 靠自己辛苦劳动（多指体力劳动）

jx.jx_en_mean: (US informal)used to urge someone not to worry
(informal)used to convey that one perceives no difficulty or problem with something
jx.jx_cn_mean: (非正式)一点都不困难；不必担心

lj.lj_ly: ‘We haven't any decaf, I'm afraid.’ ‘No sweat.’.
lj.lj_ls: “恐怕我们没有脱咖啡因的咖啡了。”“不用担心。”。

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)make an extraordinarily strenuous effort to do something

lj.lj_ly: she's sweated blood to support her family.

jx.jx_en_mean: (N. Amer. informal)be extremely anxious or nervous
jx.jx_cn_mean: (北美，非正式)非常焦虑（或担心）

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)endure an unpleasant experience, typically one involving physical exertion in great heat
jx.jx_cn_mean: (非正式)忍受（痛苦的经历，多指在炎热的环境中进行的重体力劳动）

lj.lj_ly: about 1,500 runners are expected to sweat it out in this year's run.
lj.lj_ls: 预计大约会有1,500名赛跑者将在今年的比赛中艰苦拼搏。
焦急地等待最后的分数

lj.lj_ly: “keep what they produced by the sweat of their brow”(&b{Mario Puzo})
lj.lj_ls: “通过辛勤的工作来保住他们的所得”(&b{马里奥·普佐})

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English swāt (noun), swǽtan (verb), of Germanic origin; related to Dutch zweet and German Schweiss, from an Indo-European root shared by Latin sudor

entry.def: Sweat is the salty colourless liquid which comes through your skin when you are hot, ill, or afraid.

example.ex: Both horse and rider were dripping with sweat within five minutes...
example.tran: 没过五分钟，马和骑手都大汗淋漓。

example.ex: He wiped the sweat off his face and looked around...
example.tran: 他擦了擦脸上的汗水并四处张望。

entry.def: When you sweat, sweat comes through your skin.

example.ex: Already they were sweating as the sun beat down upon them.
example.tran: 在阳光的强烈照射下他们已经汗流浃背。

entry.def: If someone is in a sweat, they are sweating a lot.

example.ex: Every morning I would break out in a sweat...
example.tran: 每天早上我都会出一身汗。

example.ex: Cool down very gradually after working up a sweat...
example.tran: 大量出汗后要慢慢降温。

entry.def: Sweats are the same as a sweatsuit or sweatpants .

entry.tran: 冒冷汗，出冷汗(指感到害怕或难堪)
entry.def: If someone is in a cold sweat or in a sweat, they feel frightened or embarrassed.

example.ex: The very thought brought me out in a cold sweat.
example.tran: 一想到这我就一身冷汗。

entry.def: If someone sweats it out, they wait anxiously for a situation to improve or be resolved, because they cannot do anything about it.

example.ex: The islanders can do little but sweat it out, wondering whether they will be forced to go and seek a new life elsewhere.
example.tran: 岛民不知道自己是否要被迫去往他处另谋生路，但却无能为力，只好干等。

entry.def: If a person says no sweat when you ask them about something or ask them to do something, they mean that it is not a problem or that it can be done quickly or easily.

example.tran: “非常感谢。”——“没什么，还需要别的吗？”

example.ex: No-one minds that she's a woman, that's no sweat at all.
example.tran: 没有人在意她是个女人，这完全没有关系。

means.word_mean: 1. salty fluid secreted by sweat glands;
3. condensation of moisture on a cold surface;

sentences.sentence: "the cold glasses were streaked with sweat"

means.word_mean: 4. use of physical or mental energy; hard work;
1. excrete perspiration through the pores in the skin;

example.en: Everybody in the office had to sweat btood that week.
example.zh: 那个星期，办事处的人都不得不拼着老命干。

example.en: Come on, don't sweat it. It'll work out.
example.zh: 得了，别为这事着急。它会解决的。
他为多挣钱拼命地工作。

example.en: I can handle it. It won't cause me any sweat.
example.zh: 这事我应付得了。它并不难，我用不着紧张的。

list.explanation: 用作形容词&ad 冷汗一身的(地)，胆战心惊的(地)

example.en: I was in a cold sweat while they counted the ballots.
example.zh: 在他们清点选票时，我是浑身冷汗。

example.en: He stood there in a cold sweat, waiting for something to happen.
example.zh: 他胆战心惊地站在那里，等待着怕出什么事。

auth_sentence.content: Unwilling to starve or sweat your way to perfection?
auth_sentence.res_content: Unwilling to starve or sweat your way to perfection?
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Unwilling to starve or sweat your way to perfection?

auth_sentence.content: His face was bright red and sheened with sweat.
auth_sentence.res_content: His face was bright red and sheened with sweat.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: His face was bright red and sheened with sweat.

auth_sentence.content: Finishing a run, sweat running down his torso.
auth_sentence.res_content: Finishing a run, sweat running down his torso.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Finishing a run, sweat running down his torso.

Sentence.sentence: I could spend months sweating over my own "paintings", but I'd produce something you wouldn't want to hang in your living room.

sentences.en: He wiped the sweat from his face.

means.word_mean: 苦差事; 艰苦的工作

sentences.en: The job's quite a sweat; I'm exhausted already.
sentences.cn: 这个工作相当吃力, 我已经筋疲力尽了。

sentences.en: He was sweating like a bullock.

jushi.english: The job's quite a sweat; I'm exhausted already.
jushi.chinese: 这个工作相当吃力,我已经精疲力竭了。

jushi.english: He wiped the sweat from his face.
The long hot climb made him sweat.
jushi.chinese: 长距离的激烈攀登使他出汗了。
